Reprocessed OSI SAF Metop-A ASCAT L2 25 km and 12.5 km winds are now available to the users. Climate Data Records have been created covering the period from January 2007 until March 2014. Scatterometer data have been collocated with ECMWF ERA-Interim winds and scatterometer level 2 wind products have been created at 25 km (http://dx.doi.org/10.15770/EUM_SAF_OSI_0006) and 12.5 km (http://dx.doi.org/10.15770/EUM_SAF_OSI_0007) swath grids. The reprocessed data, in BUFR and NetCDF format, will be available online soon from the EUMETSAT Data Centre. For now, the data are available from KNMI on request.
More information, including the Product User Manual and Validation Report is available on http://www.knmi.nl/scatterometer/ascat_cdr/. More information on the OSI SAF is available on http://www.osi-saf.org/.

The small misplacement error (max ~7km) in the land mask and geolocation of the OSI SAF sea ice concentration (OSI-401-b), sea ice edge (OSI-402-b) and sea ice type (OSI-403-b) products on the polar stereographic grid will be fixed on 27th September 2016. This error also affects the polar stereographic projection of reprocessed sea ice concentration data record (OSI-409 and OSI-409-a) and the continuous reprocessed sea ice concentration product (OSI-430). The misplacement error will NOT be corrected in the existent reprocessed products.
Test products in GRIB and NetCDF format with this correction are available here: ftp://osisaf.met.no/prod_test/ice/test_products_with_corrected_grid

Change to DCP messages from the Public DCP Service: An error has been identified in the coding of the DCP messages available from the Public DCP Service (http://oiswww.eumetsat.org/SDDI/webapps/publicdcp/). A fix will be deployed on 09/11/2016, meaning that the DCP messages processed after this date will conform to the coding as described on the DCS web page under the section 'How to retrieve data via the internet' (http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/MeteosatServices/MeteosatDataCollectionServices/index.html).
In the meantime, the fix has been implemented on our validation server which can be accessed at http://oislab.eumetsat.int/SDDI/webapps/publicdcp/ This will allow users to retrieve correct DCP messages from now until 09/11/2016, at which time the access to our validation server will be disabled.

On 21st of September the following updates will be applied on board Metop B for the SEM instrument. The Electron CDEM Bias Voltage level will be increased from level 1 to level 2, and the proton detector bias will be increased from level 2 to level 3.This will increase sensitivity to compensate for instrument aging. This is a routine activity.Exact times to be provided nearer the start date.[Rev2] :This activity will take place at 09:08UTC.

The SARAL/AltiKa mission will enter in a new phase named SARAL-DP. From July 4th onwards, SARAL satellite will fly free of station keeping manoeuvers; the repetitive ground track will be no more maintained and with the natural decay of the orbit, the ground track will drift. SARAL-DP stands for SARAL Drifting Phase.

Upgrade to CSPP SDR software version 2.2. The scale and offset values to convert from DN (digital counts) to radiance have been changed for 6 IR channels. No impact is expected on the actual radiance values. The effects of the above are visible in the radiance DN values for the IR channels. This is compensated by adjusted scale and offsets (RadianceFactors). [Rev 2]: This activity has been postponed until further notice.[Rev 3]:The update of CSPP SDR software version 2.2.2 has been rescheduled to 31/05/2016

In preparation for the update of the GRAS processing software to version v4.3.1, planned for 10/05/2016, level 1b trial data in the upcoming new product formats are made available via ftp. In addition, test data for GRAS wave optics products to be introduced into operations later this year in version v4.4 are also made available. For details, please see the provided URL below. [Rev 2]: The update of the GRAS processing software has been rescheduled to 24/05/2016 and the version number will be 4.3.2. The ROM SAF is planning an upgrade of their NRT processing system on the same day, 24/05/2016, based on the new GRAS processing software. The quality of the ROM SAF Level 2 products and the format of the ROM SAF netCDF and BUFR files will not change. [Rev 3]: The update of the GRAS processing software has been rescheduled to 08/06/2016. [Rev 4]: The rollout of the updated GRAS processing SW has been postponed until further notice, due to the discovery of unexpected regional biases which are under investigation. [Rev 5]: The regional biases have been fixed and the rollout of the updated GRAS processing software is now planned for 05/07/2016.
Investigation is on-going. [Rev. 2]: Service has been resumed. Other impacted services have been added.

Four OSI SAF sea ice products are affected by a degradation of the DMSP F17 data. These products are currently in progress of being upgraded to use DMSP F18 data instead. The ice concentration (OSI-401-b) was updated on 11/04/2016. This product is back to nominal. The ice edge and type (OSI-402-b and OSI-403-b) was updated on 12/04/2016. This product is expected to be nominal starting from 14/04/2016. The ice emissivity product (OSI-404) is temporary turned off and will resume as soon as it has been upgraded. [Rev 2]: The ice emissivity product has been upgraded and is back to nominal starting from 20/04/2016.

Maintenance upgrade of the NRT processing system at ROM SAF. The data quality will not change, but the reference azimuth angle (descriptor 0 05 021 in BUFR, Data Field 36) will be the one provided by EUMETSAT instead of the one computed at the ROM SAF.
Additionaly, the 1Dvar solution for occultations that fail the 1Dvar qualitiy check will then also be available, but with a quality flag (descriptor 0 33 039 in BUFR, bit 7) indicating that 'Meteorological processing' was non-nominal. [Rev 2]: This upgrade has been postponed by ROM-SAF. ROM-SAF is appreciating user feedback on this upgrade until Thursday 25/02/2016. [Rev 3]: Rescheduled from 22/02/2015 to 29/02/2015. A short delay in data delivery can be expected during the upgrade.

Status information for Announcement #1229 (Unavailability of MPE products): The MPE product relies not only on the availability of Meteosat data but also on an externally provided Microwave product. The specific external product is no longer available and alternative products are being investigated for use in the MPE production. Along with the technical implementation, scientific work is also required to develop a quality MPE product. Until a prototype product of good quality has been developed, a timeline for the rollout of the updated MPE product cannot be provided. [Rev 2]: The MPE product has been recovered as of today (08/10/2015 10:00 UTC).

During eclipse seasons, stray light affects the way the spacecraft instrument is commanded. There are periods where the black body calibration is performed after the instrument retrace instead of prior to it. This delays files for the time of the calibration (approximately three minutes) which then affects the data timeliness in the same way. This nominal calibration activity during eclipse season will therefore cause periods of noticeable delays to reception of data by Users.

SNPP ATMS will begin conducting daily executions of reversing the direction of the scan motor for approximately 16 seconds. The scan reversals will be scheduled to execute on the ascending side of the orbit when crossing 75N latitude no more than once per day. Each reversal will result in an approximate 1 minute of science data outage. The first daily execution will be at 01:01 UTC on 24 August.

Update to ASCAT Level 2 Soil Moisture Products at 12.5 km and 25 km swath grid. The main change consists in implementing a new model parameter database in the processing chain for Metop-A and B ASCAT soil moisture products. Another change relates to the EPS native format available from the EUMETSAT Data Centre.

Introduction of Version 3 of the AVHRR Atmospheric Motion Vectors algorithm. This version fixes a bug in the temporal vector consistency test. The Quality Index (QI) distribution is therefore modified, increasing the number of vectors with QI greater than 60. This change affects both AVHRR Polar and Global Winds. No product outage is expected during the activation of the change.

During eclipse seasons, stray light affects the way the spacecraft instrument is commanded. There are periods where the black body calibration is performed after the instrument retrace instead of prior to it. This delays files for the time of the calibration (approximately three minutes) which then affects the data timeliness in the same way. This nominal calibration activity during eclipse season will therefore cause periods of noticeable delays to reception of data by Users. Meteosat Straylight Predictions for Winter/Spring 2014 are available on EUMETSAT Website

Unavailability of several VITO-provided products due to US Government shutdown The Copernicus Global Land service uses some data from US government services (NASA and NOAA) to create some of its SPOT-VEGETATION derived products. Due to the lapse in US federal government funding, several federal US agencies have been shut down and hence do not provide any data at this moment. Because of this, the production of the FCOVER, LAI and Albedo (both the currently provided version 0 as well as upcoming version 1) and their delivery via EUMETCast, in Near Real Time, are interrupted, starting from the last dekad of September or first dekad of October. The missing products will be provided as soon as the US government services are re-started. REV.2: Resumption of delivery of previously halted VITO-provided products The Copernicus Global Land service and related efforts have resumed the production and EUMETCast delivery of the products (LAI, FCOVER, Albedo) that were previously halted due to the lapse in US government funding and input data. The missing data for the first 10 days of October has been caught up and delivered.

SSR anomaly recovery A spacecraft anomaly first detected on 17 September 2013 of the Metop-B Solid State Recorder (SSR) requires correction. This anomaly impacted the enhanced timeliness achieved through the Antarctic Data Acquisition (ADA). During the recovery period there will be a short interruption to all Metop-B products. Following the recovery the enhanced timeliness achieved via ADA will be interrupted for approximately 5 orbits.

Start of GOME-2 tandem operations phase. 1) GOME-2 on Metop-A: Switch of nominal swath width to 960 km. This will reduce the ground pixel sizes for measurements at nominal integration times of 0.1875 to 40 by 40 km. Polarisation device measurements (PMD) ground pixel sizes will be reduced to 40 by 5 km. 2) GOME-2 on Metop-A: The monthly narrow swath scanning period will be replaced with one day of scanning using a 320 km swath. 3) GOME-2 on Metop-B: Nominal scanning will be unaffected (1920 km swath). 4) GOME-2 on Metop-B: The monthly narrow scanning sequence will be removed from the 29 days repeat cycle. For details on the 29 days on-board timeline sequence for both instruments, please refer to:

Update of AAPP to v7.3. - Note that this version fixes the issue with the incorrect encoding of large PC scores, which can occur for warm scenes. - update of BUFR MASTER Table version from 14 to 16. - modification of the sub-centre value in the BUFR product in order to reflect the station (was always set to 140 previously, which is Lannion station). - update of OPS-LRS to V6-0+p12. - the date-time group in abbreviated bulletin headers (YGGgg) will be set according to the observation time instead of the file creation time. - the number of BUFR message per scan will be set to 5 to decrease the size of each message. This is to facilitate GTS/RMDCN distribution. Rev.2: Update satellite
